title: [guide] Fix inconsistency in function expression rules.
body: The link to a discussion around anonymous expressions and whether they're easy to find in ES6 ([diff](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/1036/commits/1541503fd47626e2d4b03ff01bca76940081edeb)) was lost in the PR #1008 , and introduced a slight inconsistency in the "good" example where the function expression is different from the named function, which I'm guessing was not intentional.

title: Compliant beautifier for Atom
body: Is anybody using a compliant beautifier for Atom? or has the files to configure them?

title: Publish new release to fix unmet peer dependency
body:
In the 12.0.0 release of `eslint-config-airbnb` the depencency for `eslint-plugin-import` was bumped, but not in `eslint-config-airbnb-base`. This creates a conflict of unmet peer dependency.

```
| +-- eslint-config-airbnb@12.0.0
| | +-- eslint-config-airbnb-base@8.0.0
| | `-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-import@^1.16.0
| +-- UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-import@2.0.1
```

I believe this error is fixed a week ago in https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/commit/0bb3eb541203aee1b134bef06940557cf7a30007, but not released to NPM yet.

title: Prevent PRs attempting a semicolectomy on the docs
no-extra-semi on function declaration style decoration.
imports/prefer-default-export idiomatic use
body:
hi,

how is the case where a file grows from containing only 1 function to containing 2 handled best?

example:

let's say i have a file called `window.js`, which contains only one function, `showWindow()`.
it's imported as `import { showWindow } from 'window'`.

of course this goes against imports/prefer-default-export. how should this be fixed? i guess i move the code to `window/showWindow.js`.

if i do that, then my import becomes `import showWindow from 'window/showWindow'`.
now what happens when a want to create another function, `countWindows()` ?

2 possibilities:

A.
i move `showWindow` back to `window.js` and add `countWindows` there.
if i do this, now i have to find all the places that imports `showWindow` and change those imports.

B.
i create another file called `window/countWindows.js` and put the function there.
if i do this, it means that nearly all my files will only contain 1 function.

so i wonder, how does airbnb handle this?

title: Disallow for-of
body:
The style guide [11.1](http://airbnb.io/javascript/#iterators--nope) says that you shouldn't use `for-of` and instead should use `forEach` (which I completely agree with).

That said, the ESLint rule [`no-iterator`](http://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-iterator.html) doesn't seem to enforce this, and the entry for [`no-restricted-syntax`](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/59db4aab157d98bf98c216c119e9ff848eea9505/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/style.js#L213) contains `ForInStatement` but not `ForOfStatement`.

Can we add `ForOfStatement` to `no-restricted-syntax` (or is the a better way of restricting `for-of` statements?

title: config install scripts do not force latest config version
body:
I'm getting this error:

Error: eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react: Configuration for rule "react/no-did-mount-set-state" is invalid: Value "allow-in-func" must be an enum value.

Referenced from: airbnb Referenced from: /.../project/.eslintrc

This is the default: 'react/no-did-mount-set-state': [2, 'allow-in-func']
When I set this to: 'react/no-did-mount-set-state': 2

everything is fine.

title: Add eslint plugin demo page
body: I sometimes want to write some arbitrary code and see what the Airbnb eslint configuration has to say about it. It would be nice to have a quick REPL that I could load up in the browser to run quick checks like this. Similar to https://babeljs.io/repl/
